<p>A new student from a different country joins your class, which predominantly consists of local students. You want to use this as an opportunity to teach students the value of diversity and build inclusiveness.</p>

<p>Which of these activities is BEST suited for the purpose?</p>

options.value: Have the local students tell the new student what should and should not be done in your region.
Have a discussion in class about the similarities and differences in practices in each child&#39;s home.&nbsp;
Tell the class about the new student&#39;s country including how people behave, what they value, etc.
Have each student in class voice their attitudes and knowledge about the other country.&nbsp;

hn.value:
<p>एक अलग देश से एक नया छात्र आपकी कक्षा में शामिल होता है, जिसमें मुख्य रूप से स्थानीय छात्र शामिल होते हैं। आप इसे छात्रों को विविधता का मूल्य सिखाने और समावेशिता का निर्माण करने के अवसर के रूप में उपयोग करना चाहते हैं।</p>

<p>इनमें से कौन सी गतिविधि इस उद्देश्य के लिए सबसे उपयुक्त है?</p>

options.value: क्या स्थानीय छात्र नए छात्र को बताएं कि आपके क्षेत्र में क्या करना चाहिए और क्या नहीं करना चाहिए।
प्रत्येक बच्चे के घर में प्रचलित प्रथाओं में समानता और अंतर के बारे में कक्षा में चर्चा करें।
कक्षा को नए छात्र के देश के बारे में बताएं कि लोग वहाँ कैसे व्यवहार करते हैं, वे किसको महत्व देते हैं, आदि।
कक्षा में प्रत्येक छात्र को दूसरे देश के बारे में अपने दृष्टिकोण और ज्ञान के बारे में बताएं।

en.value: Which of the following features of a video conferencing app can be used to BEST demonstrate how communication can be done without speaking?

hn.value: वीडियो कॉन्फ्रेंसिंग ऐप की निम्नलिखित में से कौन सी विशेषता का उपयोग यह प्रदर्शित करने के लिए किया जा सकता है कि बिना बोले संचार कैसे किया जा सकता है?

en.value: Which of the following exercises MOST CLOSELY aligns with the constructivist approach ?

options.value: Using pictures of animals ears to identify their adaptation.&nbsp;
Drawing the outlines of different types of leaves after plucking them from a nearby garden.&nbsp;
Using a graphic organizer to explain the uses of different structures of a fort.&nbsp;
Using a globe to identify different countries that students may have heard of.

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से कौन सा अभ्यास संरचनावादी दृष्टिकोण के साथ सबसे अधिक निकटता से सुमेलित है?

options.value: उनके अनुकूलन की पहचान करने के लिए जानवरों के कानों की तस्वीरों का उपयोग करना।
पास के बगीचे से विभिन्न प्रकार के पत्तों को तोड़कर उनकी रूपरेखा बनाना।
एक किले की विभिन्न संरचनाओं के उपयोगों को समझाने के लिए ग्राफिक आयोजक का उपयोग करना।
विभिन्न देशों, जिनके बारे में छात्रों ने सुना होगा, की पहचान करने के लिए ग्लोब का उपयोग करना।

en.value: Which of the following is the BEST example of students engaging in active learning?

options.value: Students add their thoughts on a mind map drawn on a blackboard about the different types of work that people do.&nbsp;
In pairs, students list down the different parts of a flower that were mentioned in the EVS textbook.
Students draw the different patterns people made on sarees after watching a video on Pochampalli sarees.&nbsp;
Students take notes from the blackboard about the different types of materials used in constructing buildings.

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से कौन सा सक्रिय अधिगम में संलग्न छात्रों का सबसे अच्छा उदाहरण है?

options.value: छात्र ब्लैकबोर्ड पर लोगों द्वारा किए जाने वाले विभिन्न प्रकार के कार्यों के बारे में अपने विचारों को एक मानसिक मानचित्र पर जोड़ते हैं।
युग्म में, छात्र एक फूल के विभिन्न भागों की सूची बनाते हैं जिनका उल्लेख ईवीएस पाठ्यपुस्तक में किया गया था।
पोचमपल्ली साड़ियों पर एक वीडियो देखने के बाद छात्र साड़ियों पर बने विभिन्न पैटर्न बनाते हैं।
छात्र ब्लैकबोर्ड से भवनों के निर्माण में प्रयुक्त विभिन्न प्रकार की सामग्रियों के बारे में जानकारी लेते हैं।

en.value: What would be an &#39;authentic task&#39; with respect to a lesson on cooking?

options.value: Showing students how you make a sandwich in the classroom with real ingredients.&nbsp;
Asking students to write a list of dishes that are made with wheat flour.
Conducting a &quot;fireless cooking&quot; fair in your school where students make and sell food.&nbsp;
Creating a class garden where all children are asked to grow plants like tomatoes, chilli etc.&nbsp;

hn.value: खाना पकाने के पाठ के संबंध में एक &#39;प्रामाणिक कार्य&#39; क्या होगा?

options.value: छात्रों को दिखाना कि आप कक्षा में वास्तविक सामग्री से सैंडविच कैसे बनाते हैं।
विद्यार्थियों से गेहूँ के आटे से बने व्यंजनों की सूची लिखने को कहना।
अपने विद्यालय में एक &quot;आग रहित भोजन पकाने&quot; के मेले का आयोजन करना जहाँ विद्यार्थी भोजन बनाते और बेचते हैं।
एक &#39;कक्षा उद्यान&#39; का निर्माण करना जहां सभी बच्चों को टमाटर, मिर्च आदि जैसे पौधे उगाने के लिए कहा जाए।

en.value:
<p>In a chapter about sharing feelings, one student asks, &quot;Why are you teaching us about feelings in EVS?&quot;</p>

<p>Which of the below responses BEST explains the scope of learning this chapter in EVS?</p>

options.value: We interact with other people all the time. Each person is different. Understanding our own and each other&#39;s feelings is important for living in society.
We interact with other people all the time. Some of them are differently-abled. Being sensitive to their feelings is important for living in society.
Some of you may want to become psychologists when you grow up. Understanding your own and others&#39; feelings is an important first step.&nbsp;
Feelings are closely related to hormones in the human body. As you are learning about different parts of the human body, it is important for you to understand feelings also.

hn.value:
<p>भावनाओं को साझा करने के बारे में एक अध्याय में, एक छात्र पूछता है, &quot;आप हमें ई.वी.एस. में भावनाओं के बारे में क्यों सिखा रहे हैं?&quot;</p>

<p>नीचे दी गई प्रतिक्रियाओं में से कौन सी ई.वी.एस. में इस अध्याय के&nbsp;अधिगम&nbsp;के दायरे की सबसे अच्छी व्याख्या करती है?</p>

options.value: हम हर समय अन्य लोगों के साथ अंतःक्रिया करते हैं। प्रत्येक व्यक्ति अलग है। समाज में रहने के लिए अपनी और एक-दूसरे की भावनाओं को समझना आवश्यक है।
हम हर समय अन्य लोगों के साथ <span style="">अंतःक्रिया</span> करते हैं। उनमें से कुछ दिव्यांग हैं। समाज में रहने के लिए उनकी भावनाओं के प्रति संवेदनशील होना <span style="">आवश्यक</span> है।
आप में से कुछ लोग बड़े होकर मनोवैज्ञानिक बनना चाहेंगे। अपनी और दूसरों की भावनाओं को समझना एक महत्वपूर्ण प्रथम कदम है।
भावनाओं का मानव शरीर में हार्मोन से गहरा संबंध है। जैसा कि आप मानव शरीर के विभिन्न भागों के बारे में सीख रहे हैं, आपके लिए भावनाओं को भी समझना <span style="">आवश्यक</span> है।
Why do you think white lines are drawn on roads?
Why do you use a graph book with lines, to plot points in geometry?
Why are there gridlines that appear on your camera screen when taking a photo?
Why do you use ruled notebooks for writing in school?&nbsp;
आपको क्या लगता है कि सड़कों पर सफेद रेखाएं क्यों खींची जाती हैं?
ज्यामिति में बिंदुओं को आलेखित करने के लिए आप रेखाओं वाली ग्राफ़ बुक का उपयोग क्यों करते हैं?
फ़ोटो लेते समय आपके कैमरा स्क्रीन पर ग्रिडलाइन क्यों दिखाई देती हैं?
आप विद्यालय में लिखने के लिए रेखित नोटबुक्स का उपयोग क्यों करते हैं?

en.value: For the topic &#39;historical monuments&#39;, which of these is a specific, measurable and attainable learning objective?

options.value: Student will know why stone was used to build monuments in the past.
Students will draw an architectural plan of the Taj Mahal, to appropriate scale.
Students will classify the different materials used in building the Golkonda Fort based on their purpose.&nbsp;
Students will help preserve historical monuments, recognizing the importance of these.&nbsp;

hn.value: &#39;ऐतिहासिक स्मारक&#39; विषय के लिए, इनमें से कौन एक विशिष्ट, मापने योग्य और प्राप्य अधिगम का उद्देश्य है?

options.value: विद्यार्थी को पता चल जाएगा कि अतीत में स्मारकों के निर्माण के लिए पत्थर का उपयोग क्यों किया जाता था।&nbsp;
<span style="">विद्यार्थी</span> ताजमहल की एक वास्तुशिल्प योजना को उचित पैमाने पर तैयार करेंगे।
<span style="">विद्यार्थी</span> गोलकुंडा किले के निर्माण में प्रयुक्त विभिन्न सामग्रियों को उनके उद्देश्य के आधार पर वर्गीकृत करेंगे।
<span style="">विद्यार्थी</span> इनके महत्व को पहचानते हुए ऐतिहासिक स्मारकों को संरक्षित करने में मदद करेंगे।

en.value:
<p>You have brought 1 large bottle of glue to your classroom for students to use for their projects for an upcoming exhibition. You have told students that the bottle will not be replaced once finished and they will have to use it wisely.</p>

<p>Which of the below activities would MOST help students engage on the idea of &#39;using alternative resources&#39; for resources which are limited in quantity?</p>

options.value: Put up a poster that displays the projects where glue can be used and where it cannot.
Ask students to list down different materials that are sticky, even as they work on their projects.&nbsp;
Ask students to write in a common register how many spoons of glue they took each time, when and why
Ask students to use the glue by adding water to it.

hn.value:
<p>आप अपनी कक्षा में गोंद की 1 बड़ी बोतल लेकर आए हैं ताकि छात्र आगामी प्रदर्शनी के लिए अपनी परियोजनाओं के लिए उपयोग कर सकें। आपने छात्रों से कहा है कि बोतल समाप्त होने के बाद उसे बदला नहीं जाएगा और उन्हें इसे समझदारी से उपयोग&nbsp;करना होगा।</p>

<p>निम्नलिखित में से कौन सी गतिविधि छात्रों को सीमित मात्रा में संसाधनों के लिए &#39;वैकल्पिक संसाधनों का उपयोग&#39; करने के विचार पर संलग्न होने में मदद करेगी?</p>

options.value: एक पोस्टर लगाएं जो उन परियोजनाओं को प्रदर्शित करता है जहां गोंद का उपयोग किया जा सकता है और जहां नहीं <span style="">किया</span> सकता है।
छात्रों से उन विभिन्न सामग्रियों को सूचीबद्ध करने के लिए कहें जो चिपचिपी हैं, भले ही वे अपनी परियोजनाओं पर काम कर रहे हों।
छात्रों को एक सामान्य रजिस्टर में लिखने के लिए कहें कि उन्होंने हर बार<span style="">&nbsp;कब, क्यों और</span>&nbsp;कितने चम्मच गोंद लिया<span style="">।</span>
<span style="">छात्रों</span> को गोंद में पानी मिलाकर उपयोग करने के लिए कहें।

en.value: Which of the following is the BEST example of arriving at a specific conclusion using experimentation?

options.value: Understanding which liquid flows quicker by adding a drop of each on a plate and tilting it.
Finding out how far the human eye can see by asking each student to read the alphabet from a distance.
Understanding which vegetable spoils quicker by counting the number of days it takes for them to go rotten.
Finding out the different sources of water by going on a field trip around your district.

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से कौन प्रयोग का उपयोग करके किसी विशिष्ट निष्कर्ष पर पहुंचने का सबसे अच्छा उदाहरण है?

options.value: प्लेट पर प्रत्येक तरल की एक-<span style="">एक</span> बूंद डालकर और उसे झुकाकर&nbsp;<span style="">यह समझना कि</span>&nbsp;कौन सा तरल तेजी से बहता है।
प्रत्येक छात्र को दूर से वर्णमाला पढ़ने के लिए कह कर यह पता लगाना कि मानव आँख कितनी दूर देख सकती है।
कौन सी सब्जी जल्दी खराब हो जाती है यह किसी&nbsp;सब्जी को सड़ने में कितने दिन लगे, इसकी गणना करके समझ सकते हैं।&nbsp;
अपने जिले के आसपास क्षेत्रीय दौरे पर जाकर जल के विभिन्न स्रोतों का पता लगाना।

en.value: Which of the following is MOST relevant as a &#39;hook&#39; or &#39;opening&#39;, for introducing the topic of &#39;seasons&#39;?

options.value: Describing the differences between summer and winter in terms of temperature, clothing, activities, plants, etc.
Showing students a hat, a raincoat and a sweater, and asking them which of these they have used.
Taking students on a walk and asking them to describe how plants will change in the following season.
Showing students a video of sunrise to sunset to sunrise again, with corresponding changes in people&#39;s activities.

hn.value: &#39;ऋतुओं&#39; के विषय को प्रस्तुत करने के लिए निम्नलिखित में से कौन &#39;हुक&#39; या &#39;ओपनिंग&#39; के रूप में सबसे अधिक प्रासंगिक है?

options.value: तापमान, कपड़ों, गतिविधियों, पौधों आदि के संदर्भ में गर्मी और सर्दी के बीच के अंतरों का वर्णन करना।
विद्यार्थियों को एक टोपी, एक रेनकोट और एक स्वेटर दिखाना, और उनसे पूछना कि उन्होंने इनमें से किसका उपयोग किया है।
विद्यार्थियों को सैर पर ले जाना और उनसे यह वर्णन करने के लिए कहना कि आने वाले मौसम में पौधे कैसे बदलेंगे।
<span style="">विद्यार्थियों</span> को लोगों की गतिविधियों में संबंधित परिवर्तनों के साथ सूर्योदय से सूर्यास्त तक और फिर से सूर्योदय तक का वीडियो दिखाना।

options.value: हम कोविड के प्रसार को रोकने के लिए मास्क का उपयोग क्यों करते हैं लेकिन मधुमेह के प्रसार को रोकने के लिए ऐसा क्यों नहीं करते हैं?

en.value:
<p>A teacher wants to use technology to teach her students about different world heritage sites and understand their architecture, historical background, etc.</p>

en.value: Which of the following is not true according to the passage?
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the correct / most appropriate options.

Studies serve for delight, for ornament, and for ability. Their chief use for delight is in privateness and retiring; for ornament, is in discourse; and for ability, is in judgment, and disposition of business. For expert men can execute, and perhaps judge of particulars, one by one; but the general counsels, and the plots and marshalling of affairs, come best, from those that re learned. To spend too much time in studies is sloth; to use them too much for ornament, is affection; to make judgement wholly by their rules, is the humor of a scholar. They prefer nature, and are perfected by experience; for natural abilities are like natural plants, that need pruning, by study; and studies themselves, do give forth directions too much at large, except they be bounded in by experience. Crafty men condemn studies, simple men admire them, and wise men use them, won by observation. Read not to contradict and consider. Some books are to be tasted, other to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested; that is some books are to be read only in parts; others to be read, but not curiously; and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention. Some books also may be read by deputy, and extracts made of them by others; but that would be only in the less important arguments, and the meaner sort of books, else distilled books are like common distilled waters, flashy things.

They enhance our ability to judge things well.

en.value: Why does the poet want to go to Innisfree?
en.comp:
Read the extract given below and answer the questions that follow by selecting the correct / most appropriate options:

I will arise and go now, and go the Innisfree,
And a small cabin build there, of clay and wattles made:
Nine bean-rows will I have there, A hive for the honeybee,
And live alone in the bee-loud glade.

And I shall have some peace there, for peace comes dropping slow
Dropping from the veils of the morning to where the cricket sings;
There midnight's all a glimmer, and noon a purple glow,
And evenings full of the linnet's wings.

I will arise and go now, for always night and day
I hear the lake water lapping with low sound by the shore:
While I stand on the roadway, or on the pavements grey,
I hear it in deep heart's core.

He has been invited by his friends staying there.

en.value: What prompted the state governments to reopen schools?
en.comp:
Direction: Read the following passage and answer the questions by choosing the correct/most appropriate options:

State governments have taken the difficult decision to reopen schools for some classes, encouraged by a consensus among public health experts that benefit to students and society at large outweigh the risks of COVID-19 increase. A week after many of them reopened, mainly at the secondary and higher secondary level, infections among teachers and students have not triggered an alarm, although general social attitudes towards the pandemic have turned negligent. Data from Tamil Nadu show that post-reopening, about 30 students and teachers have tested positive, to which the State has responded by tracing contacts and testing, while keeping the institutions open. Kerala, which has struggled to contain the infection rate and continues to report about 25,000 cases a day, is venturing only to reopen residential higher education institutions and final-year college classes within a bio-bubble of at least single-dose vaccination; reopening of schooling continues to pose a challenge.

The paralysing absence of education for millions in the country has raised the question of whether governments have shown alacrity to limit the harm from prolonged closures. A study by economists in August showed that a mere 8% of students in rural areas had regular access to online learning and 37% were not studying at all. It also found that only a minority of students with smartphones, i.e., 31% in urban areas and 15% in rural settings, received regular instruction. This crisis has remained neglected for over a year, and the findings underscore the need for an in-person teaching resume.

Among the major concerns surrounding reopening of schools is possible transmission of the virus on campuses, with implications for vulnerable individuals in the students' home. Here, the advocacy of the European Technical Advisory Group on schooling during COVID-19 - smaller class sizes, wider spaces between desks and staggered breaks at school - is worth considering. The panel underscores the importance of evolving a follow-up protocol, when a cluster of cases leads to school-wide testing. Many public health experts argue that younger children, typically in the 60 to 14 age group, have the lowest risk of moderate or severe COVID-19 infection, while this is also the group that needs good foundational teaching. Most of these students are not eligible for vaccination. WHO recommends that for these pupils, the approach towards reopening should be cautions : risk based, and taking note of community transmission, ability to maintain physical distancing and good ventilation. Vaccination of teachers and school staff and eligible students, and free testing for all are other major factors.

options.value: <span style="">Pressure on the part of parents.</span>
<span style="">Considerable decline in COVID-19 pandemic cases.</span>
<span style="">To make up for loss of studies.</span>

en.value: Identify the statement which is <strong>not true</strong> according to facts mentioned in the passage?
en.comp:
Direction: Read the following passage and answer the questions by choosing the correct/most appropriate options:

State governments have taken the difficult decision to reopen schools for some classes, encouraged by a consensus among public health experts that benefit to students and society at large outweigh the risks of COVID-19 increase. A week after many of them reopened, mainly at the secondary and higher secondary level, infections among teachers and students have not triggered an alarm, although general social attitudes towards the pandemic have turned negligent. Data from Tamil Nadu show that post-reopening, about 30 students and teachers have tested positive, to which the State has responded by tracing contacts and testing, while keeping the institutions open. Kerala, which has struggled to contain the infection rate and continues to report about 25,000 cases a day, is venturing only to reopen residential higher education institutions and final-year college classes within a bio-bubble of at least single-dose vaccination; reopening of schooling continues to pose a challenge.

The paralysing absence of education for millions in the country has raised the question of whether governments have shown alacrity to limit the harm from prolonged closures. A study by economists in August showed that a mere 8% of students in rural areas had regular access to online learning and 37% were not studying at all. It also found that only a minority of students with smartphones, i.e., 31% in urban areas and 15% in rural settings, received regular instruction. This crisis has remained neglected for over a year, and the findings underscore the need for an in-person teaching resume.

Among the major concerns surrounding reopening of schools is possible transmission of the virus on campuses, with implications for vulnerable individuals in the students' home. Here, the advocacy of the European Technical Advisory Group on schooling during COVID-19 - smaller class sizes, wider spaces between desks and staggered breaks at school - is worth considering. The panel underscores the importance of evolving a follow-up protocol, when a cluster of cases leads to school-wide testing. Many public health experts argue that younger children, typically in the 60 to 14 age group, have the lowest risk of moderate or severe COVID-19 infection, while this is also the group that needs good foundational teaching. Most of these students are not eligible for vaccination. WHO recommends that for these pupils, the approach towards reopening should be cautions : risk based, and taking note of community transmission, ability to maintain physical distancing and good ventilation. Vaccination of teachers and school staff and eligible students, and free testing for all are other major factors.

en.value: Which of the following facts are <u><strong>NOT</strong></u> mentioned in the passage?
en.comp:
Read the following passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the correct/most appropriate options:

As primary education became compulsory from the late nineteenth century, children became critical for the publishing industry. As children's press, devoted to literature for children alone, was set up in France in 1857. This press published new works as well told fairy tales and folk tales. The Grimm Brothers in Germany spent years compiling traditional folk tales gathered from peasants. What they collected was edited before the stories were published in a collection in 1812 . Anything that was considered unsuitable for children or would appear vulgar to the elite, was not included in the published version. Rural folk tales thus acquired a new form. In this way, print recorded old tales but also changed them.

Women became important as readers as well as writers. Penny magazines were especially meant for women, as manuals teaching proper behaviour and housekeeping. Novelists in the nineteenth century saw women as important readers. Some of the best-known novelists were women : the Bronte sisters, George Eliot. Their writings became important in defining a new type of woman : a person with will, strength of personality, determination and power to think.

Lending libraries were in existence from the seventeenth century onwards. In the nineteenth century, lending libraries in English became instruments for educating white-collar workers, artisans and lower-middle class people. Sometimes, self-educated working class people wrote for themselves. After the working day was gradually shortened from the mid-nineteenth century, worker had some time for self-improvements and self-expression. They wrote political tracts and autobiographies in large numbers.

<span style="">The education departments supported publications for children.</span>
